result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي هَٰذَا لَبَلَٰغٗا لِّقَوۡمٍ عَٰبِدِينَ
result.translation: Dájúdájú ohun tí ó máa tó ẹ̀dá (nípa ọ̀rọ̀ ayé àti ọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀run)[1] wà nínú (al-Ƙur’ān) yìí fún ìjọ tó ń jọ́sìn (fún Allāhu ní ọ̀nà òdodo).
result.footnotes: 1. Ìtúmọ̀ méjì ló wà fún “balāg” nínú āyah yìí. Ìtúmọ̀ kejì nìyí, Dájúdájú “ohun tí ó máa mú ẹ̀dá gúnlẹ̀ síbi ìyọ́nú Allāhu” wà nínú (al-Ƙur’ān) yìí fún ìjọ tó ń jọ́sìn (fún Allāhu ní ọ̀nà òdodo). (Tafsīr ’Adwā’il-bayān li Ṣinƙītiy)
